iebaker.neon.world

Class PerlinSampler

  • java.lang.Object
    • iebaker.neon.world.PerlinSampler

  • public class PerlinSampler
extends java.lang.Object
    PerlinSampler is a class which can create a dense grid of a certain (but expandable) intiial width and initial height, with a set vector density, and set dimensionality. Information about Perlin Noise used in this implementation taken from The Perlin Noise Math FAQ

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String... args)
      Creates a test implementation of an 11 x 11 perlin grid of sidewidth 20.0, and dimension 2
      float sample(float x, float y)
      Returns a floating point value for the noise function at the point (x, y) by sampling the Perlin noise function.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PerlinSampler

        public PerlinSampler(float gridwidth,
             int initialwidth,
             int initialheight,
             int dimension)
        Constructor. Creates the perlin sampler with a set density, width, height, and dimension. To understand this: The parameter for density sets the side length of a single Perlin grid square. The width sets the number of these squares in the x dimension and the height sets the number of these squares in the y dimension.
        Parameters:
        gridwidth - The width, a floating point value, of each gridsquare
        initialwidth - The number of grid squares in the x dimension
        initialheight - The number of grid squares in the y dimension
        dimension - The dimension of the random vectors chosen.

      • PerlinSampler

        public PerlinSampler(float gridwidth,
             int initialwidth,
             int initialheight,
             int dimension,
             long seed)
        Constructor. Creates a perlin sampler with a set density, width, height, dimension, and seed for random number generation. Use this one to create perlinSamplers which will generate the same values (seeded).
        Parameters:
        gridwidth - The width, a floating point value, of each gridsquare
        initialwidth - The number of grid squares in the x dimension
        initialheight - The number of grid squares in the y dimension
        dimension - The dimension of the random vectors chosen.
        seed - A Seed to be used by the random number generator

    • Method Detail

      • sample

        public float sample(float x,
           float y)
        Returns a floating point value for the noise function at the point (x, y) by sampling the Perlin noise function.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position at which to sample
        y - The y position at which to sample
        Returns:
        The floating point value of the noise function at (x, y)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String... args)
        Creates a test implementation of an 11 x 11 perlin grid of sidewidth 20.0, and dimension 2
